page.title: 16LICHFIELD FIRE STATION
page.content:
{The Lichfield Fire Station} was
uilt in 1964.There are several fire engines and a permanent staff that work on shifts. The firemen need to have 5 "O"levels before they are accepted for training. Physically they must be fit, able to carry a 12 stone man over 100 metres. They must also have a chest measurement of 36 inches, extending to 38 inches. Their duties are not confined to fire fighting. They may be called upon to pump out water from flooded houses. They may be required to free people trapped in the wreckage of cars or trains.Pets, particularly cats, may require rescuing from trees. Firemen may be called to deal with domestic chimneys that have caught alight.The detection of arson is also part of their duties.
